name: Javed Khan
content: Javed's MCS Home Page Courses Research interest Graduate students Personal research pages Research Publications More Publications (older) Research links Kent State University Kent State Computer Science Kent State Calender Kent Schedule of Courses Contact info/Office hours javed@kent.edu Page last updated August  24, 2012 Dr. Javed I. Khan Professor & Chair Department of Computer Science Kent State University Research Interest: Applying multi-area expertise in cross-cutting problems in networking and communication. Recent topics are concurrent networking, network  based systems and applications, semantic composition, complex community, man/machine symbiotic communication. Other interests include active & programmable networking, parallel and distributed computing, video/image transmission and communication, MPEG, video/ image database, complex system exploration and visualization, content-based image search, associative information retrieval, medical imaging, PACS, holographic associative memory, fault-tolerant parallel algorithms. Laboratory: Media Communications and Networking Research Laboratory Research Profile: To get a research profile click here. Graduate Thesis/Topics: Information for graduate students searching for research area/topics Opportunities Upcoming Courses in Internetworking and WWW Graduate Affairs (CPT, Thesis, Rules etc.) Research Labs: Networking and Media Communications Research Lab | [Mirror Site] MEDIANET Collaboration Server | [Mirror Site] Internet Teaching Lab (ITL) Student Research Portal Activities Guest Editor, Disruptive Networking [DOI] Guest Editor, Foundation of Peer-to-Peer Systems [DOI] [call for paper] Guest Editor, Active and Programmable Internet [call for paper] Editor: International Jounral of Distance Education Technologies NASA Space Internet (SI) Workshop New Vision in Large Scale Netwoking (LSN) IEEE Technical Committee on The Internet Interest/Expertise Medical Systems Networking (DICOM, PACS, HL7), Medical Imaging Video Security, Extreme Networking, Monitoring, Transcoding (MPEG-2, MPEG-7, HDT) ISP Traffic Engineering (BGP), Web based Enterprize Systems & Services, International Research & Education Networks, Digital Library, LMS, Digital Campus.
